Maritim Hotel Frankfurt
7.9 Very good
Based on 146 reviews

The Maritim Hotel is a top-tier property designed more to meet the requirements of a business traveler than a leisure traveler.

While the hotel offers all the amenities and infrastructure required for a business trip, it is not within walking distance of tourist attractions. For reference, take notice that it is very close to the Frankfurt Messe (prime location for trade fairs and exhibitions). The hotel offers an excellent breakfast buffet, particularly on Sundays (late brunch). The hotel also offers an indoor swimming pool and exercise area with state-of-the-art equipment. Be aware that free parking is not available on the premises and also that smoking rooms are available on request. The staff is very professional and courteous.

Show more
Günther , Mexico
Adina Apartment Hotel Frankfurt Westend
8.8 Excellent
Based on 110 reviews

I stayed at Adina Apartment hotel near Messe Frankfurt. I chose this hotel because of its location as I was looking for the hotel which is closed to the Messe hall, and it was perfect location for me - only 5-7 min walk.

The room was very new, clean and includes all facilities even laundry machine, dishwasher, oven, and iron. All essential amenitites available - shampoo, handsoap, lotion and hair dryier. Complementary breakfast is very nice compared to its price and I really enjoyed every morning thanks to its very friendly staffs. I definitely choose this hotel if I visit Frankfurt next time. Strongly recommend!

Show more
Jihyun , South Korea
Steigenberger Frankfurter Hof
8.4 Excellent
Based on 139 reviews

This hotel is obviously a magnificent building. the newly refurbished rooms are a delight, BUT to be a real 5 stars, you need: - Not charging WIFI.

The wifi is free but at slow speed. Charging customers who pay 500 euros per night for normal internet speed is ridiculous and is a major marketing mistakes. What is the point of alienating customers to gain pennies?? - The cleaning staff has missed an unpleasant stain in the bathroom for 2 days. Not acceptable in a 5 stars - Some of the staff is very competent ( the 2 concierges), some others belong in a lesser category hotel. - There has been a lengthly and total breakdown of internet (more than 18 hours). That can happen, yes, but in that case you handle the customers in a different way than "I am sorry, I do not know when the service will be restored..." In summary: expensive, disappointing. The management is not on top of things

Show more
Thierry , France
Hotel Continental
7.4 Very good
Based on 268 reviews

the service with a smile, condusive and i am very like the toilet of hotel. for my experience to germany, i think this hotel have a great location.

the location very close with frankfurt station and nearest the shops especially kebab shop. but one more thing, i would like to suggest why not the hotel put the arrow of the kiblat (for muslim pray). if they do it, the hotel very lovely, great and excellent. although the hotel have a small room but it very comportable and i am really like it this hotel. the hotel also very clean, and always good condition. i really satisfied this hotel. thank you.

Show more
Mohd , Malaysia
Leonardo Hotel Frankfurt City Center
7.7 Very good
Based on 445 reviews

the leonardo hotel frankfurt city center has the following advantages: - very short distance to the train main station frankfurt (comfortable if you have a lot of luggage) - easy connections to frankfurt airport via s-bahn beneath the main station - good breakfast - acceptable prices for a stopover disadvantages: - small and pretty basic rooms - due to the number of rooms and their size on one level it might be quite loud - the area the hotel is located in comes with some simple and small restaurants, is close to the red-light district and appears a bit dirty and a lot of traffic

Stefan , Germany
IntercityHotel Frankfurt
7.9 Very good
Based on 755 reviews

I book InterCityHotel Frankfurt because it was near enough to the train station to walk and far enough from the train station that you don't hear the train sounds at all.

Room was very comfortable and clean. No weird smells. As it was a non-smoking floor on the ground floor, it wasn't safe to keep the windows open. So I could only open the windows for a short while to air out the room and close it again. Something that I definitely didn't like. The breakfast buffet spread were as good as the hotels in Asia with a very good variety of food. The space in the restaurant wasn't cramped and everything was very clean. Room was clean. Pillows and blankets were fluffy and thick unlike Mercure Hotels which was really flat. Also, there were no leftover smoke smells in the rooms as it's common to find non-smoking rooms in Germany that smelled very badly of a smoke in there. For dinner, I went and bought food from the food outlets at the train station. For drinks and yogurt, I went to the basement Rossman shop which was cheaper compared to the shops above ground. The only thing is that the Frankfurt Train Station is dark and can be unsafe. If it was better lighted, it would definitely have been a lot better.

Show more
Rowena , Malaysia
Wyndham Grand Hotel Frankfurt
8.5 Excellent
Based on 184 reviews

I love it very much. Hotel staffs are very friendly from the front desk to the housekeeper. Everything in the hotel room is very clean and thoughtful functional design.

The quality fast free wifi of the hotel is a big plus for me because I have to get my work done at the end of the day. The well equipped room provided everything we could need from bedding to mini-bar to high technology coffee maker to quality hair-dryer in the bathroom. And the bathroom provided 3 extra towels small and large and I get to enjoy the rain shower at the end of meeting. Everything and every details about this hotel was memorable.

Show more
Apirat , Thailand
Steigenberger Metropolitan Frankfurt Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 261 reviews

The stay was comfortable. There were no hassles as the hotel is situated next to the railway station and close to many good restaurants.

My wife & me were travelling from Seattle, USA to New Delhi and wanted to have a break to take care of the jet lag. I had been travelling to Frankfurt very frequently in eighties & used to stay at the Steigenberger Frankfurter Hoff most of the times. I was really impressed. So I decided to stay this time at the Steigenberger Metropolitan. One suggestion-please keep a few more tea bags for the tea drinkers, or replace the coffee bags with tea bags, on request of the guests and don't charge for one or 2 extra tea bags.

Show more
Harish , India
Hilton Garden Inn Frankfurt Airport
8.6 Excellent
Based on 620 reviews

Very Comfortable bed with dial adjustment, nice modern room with bath. Internet. super slow snail pace.

. Was the slowest of all our 21 days of Germany, Prague & Italy holiday. minutes to load a google page, ended up using a €50 Euro vodafone sim card. Location is fantastic for the airport and Train station is literally underneath the hotel. Silent room, could see the planes approach for landing out the window but couldn't hear them. I mentioned the internet was slow but the TV system is new and has the latest movies for around €15, It wasn't clear to me if the cost was per movie or unlimited? Maybe Hilton could comment? Laptop could plug into the TV via HDMI(by unplugging their system) so that was good. Great TV gentle alarm clock and a great for dummies bedside radio AUX noise box. GREAT *SINGLE* Clothes Washer €4.50 & Dryer ~=€4 actually need more than 1 pair though as a long wait to use it, also the reception shop had ran out of detergent (tablets i assume) to sell, but friendly staff provided some in a glass via room service but it did take 45+ minutes. I would stay again as I heard the internet is getting upgraded from the tin can and string.

Show more
Mark , Australia
NH Collection Frankfurt City
8.1 Excellent
Based on 211 reviews

well this was my 1st time in NH Frankfurt City althought i have been to NH Airport. the service for this hotel was excellent as teh staff were so friendly and cater to our need without any questions.

we got a twin bed and they immediately notice that were were a couple and change our rooms to a large queen size bed. the room was large enough and it was clean. teh internet was great althought we had head bad feedback on this prior to our arrival. never had any internet issues and can even recive it at teh next door restrauant. we had a train delay on our departure which was late in the evening and they granted us late check out which was excellent.the breakfast was excellent as there were wide varity to choose from although its kinda costly. to think of it the breakfast opens till noon on sunday tehrfore it worth have late brunch.as we speak i just book another 2 nite stay on our return from Paris. great location for shopping too.

Show more
Mavin , Singapore
Hilton Frankfurt Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 114 reviews

Great location for sighseeing and get to other cities. To me, it was not a pleasant stay as I was told by one of the staff that I could enjoy complimentary breakfast on next day morning.

However, it was not. I joined the local tour and had been waiting for the tour driver at the reception for 10 mins. The hotel staff told me that the driver couldn't find me and left the hotel. I had to take a cab from the hotel to the gathering point. No signage showing the gathering point for tour travellers. To conclude, it was the communication problems. Other things - perfect.

Show more
Yee , Hong Kong
Capri by Fraser Frankfurt
9 Excellent
Based on 63 reviews

Everything perfect! Room size, furniture, kitchen and electronics are new and good working. In the kitchen I missed a couple of things for the third person like cups.

.. . The same with the bed for the third person. We had to ask for all stuff and @ the end we only got a blanked. I guess we just had a missunderstanding but it would have been nice if everything were provided before ou arrival. The area is clean and realy close by the trainstation and old town of Frankfurt. The crew of Capri is realy helpfull and nice. If you have any question about the city or things around Frankfurt I would be suprised if they can´t help you. I would stay in Capri by Fraser again. Although because of their chef who makes the perfect steak;-)

Show more
Johannes , Germany
Jumeirah Frankfurt
9 Excellent
Based on 109 reviews

+++ - very good location, directly on the zeil pedestrian streen. +++ - just 4 station by "s" train directly to messe +++ - very new, good furnished and quite big rooms +++ - good views to the city from the windows.

+++ - luxurious bathrobes ;) +++ - free coffee machine in room --- - the service - so so poor (quite terrible): > cleaning - bed lined was not changed to new ones for sure > the floor in the bath-rooms was not cleaned every time > wc - nobody cleaned > shampoo and other vials did not changed to new one after use > there is no tooth-brush and tooth-paste! --- iron in the room - so bad and cheap chinese quality, can not be used well. the water tank can not be closed, there is no coating surface, so your shirt can be damaged. the iron desk so dirty. --- i asked receition manager for free late checkout 1 day before i leave. he told be - all is booked, so not possible - even he did not checked by computer. the next day ones the staff has changed, i asked for same to new girl at the receiption desk - she provide me with late checkout before 14:00 without problems, because it was the last day at the fair, so the hotel was not fully booked for sure. --- paid internet :(

Show more
Sergey , Russia
Toyoko Inn Frankfurt am Main Hauptbahnhof
8.5 Excellent
Based on 50 reviews

Hilton Frankfurt Airport
8.5 Excellent
Based on 271 reviews

We spent one night in Frankfurt on transit to our final destination and chose an airport hotel for convenience.

The Hilton Airport hotel was chosen as it met our budget and also the hotel looked beautiful in pictures. It is only a year old. A very lovely modern hotel and my 10-yr-old loved the bathtub. Our room on the 7th floor overlooked the expressway and out into lush greenery. We did not opt for breakfast in the hotel as it was a pricey €33 for adults and half of that price for kids. We did have trouble getting access to the hotel from the airport as we realized after crossing the road from the terminal, that there were no lifts to take us up to the Squaire area. Thankfully we met a security guy who so wonderfully helped us take our very heavy 3 suitcases up the escalator. We hope more signs can be placed around the airport or the Squaire to give more directions to travellers on how to get there.

Show more
DEBRA , Singapore
NH Frankfurt Messe
8.8 Excellent
Based on 80 reviews

Stayed here in June at start of 3 month Europe trip. Arrived in hottest summer and after walking from train station the offer of cold drinks was welcomed.

Staff are friendly and helpful. NH hotel room was compact but really great value. Nice and clean with everything we could ask for. Located near main transport making sightseeing easy. Free fruit at reception was a nice touch, one which we have noticed other hotels doing as we journed thru Europe.

Show more
Terence , Australia
Savoy Hotel
7.2 Very good
Based on 401 reviews

The Savoy is located directly across the street from the Frankfurt Main train station, which makes it a convenient location for traveling and sightseeing.

We stayed at the hotel for one night as a transit on our way back to Asia. The hotel room was small, which did not bother us much. However, there were no temperature controls in the room, only a fan. It was a relatively cool evening, but the room was really hot. We had to open the windows to let the cool air in, but because of that, it was much too loud to get a good night's sleep. Additionally, you have to pay for internet, which would have been fine if the connection was good. Unfortunately not the case. We paid for 30-minute block for internet and because it was so slow, could not do much. The additional stars on this review however were given for the really wonderful German breakfast buffet (they had pretty much anything you wanted. Really impressive spread) and the helpful staff.

Show more
Anthony , United States
NH Frankfurt Niederrad
7.9 Very good
Based on 66 reviews

My husband and I stayed on 17-18 June and 23 June. Rooms are modestly priced and amply accomplish the major tasks of a hotel, to provide a safe, clean, comfortable, and quiet place to sleep and shower.

Front desk staff was quite helpful, allowing us to leave our baggage at the hotel while we were touring, as we arrived long before the check-in time. The hotel offers van service to and from the airport - free from the airport, 5 Euros to airport. The hotel is one stop from the Frankfurt Hauptbonhof (central train station). There are supermarkets right next to the hotel, with a decent Indian Curry restaurant very nearby. Free (slow) wifi is available; I gather premium wifi is available for an additional price. Downsides were that the breakfast at 20+ Euros was overpriced, as was the restaurant on location. The neighborhood, while perfectly safe, is also perfectly boring, with little to attract a tourist - though there do appear to be some community flower gardens near the hotel. The train station is a 15 minute walk, as are restaurant options beyond the hotel and the Indian curry place. (I like Indian food, so I was perfectly happy to eat at the nearby restaurant.) And the limited wi-fi and computer facilities may not work well for business travelers. But these are relatively minor quibbles. NH Frankfurt Niederrad does not merit 5 stars in my opinion, but it's a good, solid, reliable 4-star option. I would gladly stay there again!

Show more
David , United States
Fleming's Selection Hotel Frankfurt-City
7.6 Very good
Based on 20 reviews

DORMERO Hotel Frankfurt Messe
8.4 Excellent
Based on 67 reviews

The rooms at the Domero were excellent. Large plasma screen TV with a great selection of movies and TV shows.

I found the atmosphere of the Dormero a bit lacking, at times I felt like I was the only one staying there and all times I went for breakfast and dinner I was completely on my own. Food was good though.

Show more
David , Ireland
Sheraton Frankfurt Airport Hotel & Conference Center
8 Very good
Based on 76 reviews

Club Floor: Buffét etc on the club floor is very poor compared to what price you have to pay. When we arrived in the middle of the day the only thing offered was peanuts and bananas?! Wouldn´t call this a 5-star hotel.

Recommended for busniess travellers needing a place to live at/close to the airport. Hotel is old "east german" style, but still clean and fresh. Location is located AT the airport, just a few steps away from the terminal.

Show more
Andreas , Sweden
Leonardo Royal Hotel Frankfurt
7.3 Very good
Based on 115 reviews

The hotel staff were very helpful as when we first got to the hotel, it was 7am and we couldn't check in yet, they helped to keep our luggages and showed us the direction to the city centre and provide us with a map.

The hotel is a distance away from the town centre but it is easily accessible with bus as it is available every 15 mins interval in day time and 30 mins at night. Getting back to the hotel is also a breeze, just hop on to the same bus route number. Though to go to the exhibition centre may be a bit time consuming as you need to take the bus from the hotel to the city centre to hop on to the subway before reaching the exhibition centre. Overall, the price is pretty decent comparatively.

Show more
Derrick , Malaysia
Hotel Hamburger Hof
8.3 Excellent
Based on 135 reviews

The breakfast is really fresh and delicious. Not to mention the rooms are very clean , very bright, very cosy and very comfortable.

It is minimalist, with a tint of green upholstery . The location is excellent, just 2 minutes away from Frankfurt a.M HBF. Staff are very polite and very kind. I left my camera lens cap 1 hour after we checked out, while most housekeeping lady won't bother to look for it, she digged the trash can and voila ! Found it. The Front Office lady is very sweet and very kind. Wi-Fi (you gotta pay), is functioning well and fast.

Show more
Nathania , Indonesia
Skyline Hotel Frankfurt
7.9 Very good
Based on 35 reviews

Very, very new hotel. Low price perhaps as they're trying to build a clientele. Location is a bit remote: if walking from the train station you will pass no less than 20 other hotels before finally reaching this one.

Building (despite deceptive name) is a low-slung 4-story structure on a street of similar-sized buildings. Non-descript. Across the street from the Skyline Mall (hence the name, we were informed). There's no restaurant, just space for a coffee -- served from a machine fthat is promptly turned off at 10 a.m. sharp. Staff in no way guest or service oriented here. But at least the desk people step outside to enjoy their cigarettes; you only have to step around them to gain access to the building. Rooms are small, with modern fittings, comfortable enough. Booking on-line, the price varied day-by-day, despite the hotel being virtually empty.

Show more
Mark , United States
Hotel National Frankfurt
7.7 Very good
Based on 141 reviews

The area surrounding the central station doesn´t have much to offer in tourist attractions, but on this occasion our top priority was the convenience of quick and easy access to the trains.

The Hotel National was fewer than 2 blocks away from the station, and we didn´t need more than 5 minutes to reach our respective departure platforms - all at a competitive price. The hotel is a non-smoking property. Our standard room had a high ceiling and was comfortable all-around. The amount of space was average for a city hotel in Europe, and the closet was more than adequate in terms of area. The room included complimentary coffee and tea, a mini-bar with basic stock, flat-screen TV with international programming, and safety-deposit box. All staff members were courteous, efficient, and fluent in English. We truly enjoyed the breakfast buffet which is open from 6:30 or so until 10:00. We were very satisfied with our stay and look forward to trying to reserve this hotel again for another trip later this year!

Show more
Gunther , Mexico
Bristol Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 285 reviews

I booked this hotel because I was looking for accommodation that is above backpackers' standard and give me a little breathing space.

I do not need a lot of space and neither do I want to cramp myself in small room with several beds. I was allocated a room at the end of the corridor on the highest floor. The key to the room is literally a key (it feels very ancient to carry the key). Because it was summer already, the room was warm and was so for my 2 nights stay. Luckily I could manage sleep with the fan provided. It is only 3 mins walk from the station. ie I can hear the trains. Also, because it is just opposite a café and my room is facing the other side, I could hear a group of them chatting very loudly until the wee hours like 2am. Another reason why I chose this hotel was the provision of free internet access. However, only the wifi is free but the wired LAN is chargable at about 10Euro. And somehow, I could access the wifi in my room but can't connect to the internet both on my laptop and smartphone. When I used my smartphone at the lobby and restaurant, I managed to get through into the internet. Pretty weird. Maybe it is the signal device in iPhone. The receptionist has a mixed of characters. Some were friendly and others were not very keen to answer more of the questions. They a selection of tv channels but those I understood was the News Channels like BBC CNBC etc. They have a eco policy of exchanging for a free 5euro voucher if you decline housekeeping. I redeemed a bottle of beer with that at the bar. So if you are travelling and not fussy and prefer the train station, this is an option. Otherwise, you can look for some place that is bigger, provides better service and closer to the shopping belt. BThe shopping area was about 15 mins away from this hotel. This is surely a touch and go hotel. Not for romance nor family I guess.

We booked this hotel two months in advance and requested high floor, non smoking room. When arrived, there were no available room so we had to wait.

We decided to go out for a meal and stroll in the city. When we returned, a room was given to us. It was on 1st floor, and, as we later found out, on a smoking floor. Our room has connecting doors to other our adjacent rooms (assuming they are to be used when booking for family). Smoke came through those doors at night, creating a very uncomfortable atmosphere for us that do nor smoke. Staff at the hotel could have mentioned this to us while handing us the key - as we would have waited until a room on smoke-free floor is available. In the end, we were moved to another room but of course, had to repack and unpack again, something not so convenient as we had a lot of stuff for staying for a week. During our stay, we noticed they never vacuumed the carpet or take away a bottle of beer I left next to the desk. Other services were very basic, so do not expect anything great from the staff. Plus were the free wifi and minibar. Breakfast was extensive but after two days you realize it never changes.

Traveler impressions of Frankfurt am Main

Just as in other large cities in Germany, Frankfurt was completely destroyed by the allied forces' bombing during the WWII.

The city was completely rebuilt and now it is the major financial center in the Europe. There is not much of historical sights to see as in countryside of Germany. However, it is a gate of entry to other beautiful sight seeing such as Rhine and Main river cruising, Heidelberg, Franconian wine country, and Romantic Road.

More about Frankfurt am Main

Frankfurt is truly a city of contrasts. Monolithic skyscrapers sit beside traditional half-timbered houses and centuries-old cathedrals. And, though many remnants of Frankfurt's past remain, the city is one of the chief financial and business centers of Europe. As such, it's just as popular a destination for business as it is for tourism, and the high standard of services and technology offered at Frankfurt hotels reflects this. Frankfurt am Main International Airport is the gateway into the city, so hotels near Frankfurt Airport are always close to full capacity, as are hotels in Bahnhofsviertel, where Frankfurt train station is located.

Frankfurt, like many European cities, is connected by a vast subway network that is both efficient and easy to navigate. Trains provide easy access to historical areas such as Romerberg with its gorgeous old buildings from the 14th and 15th centuries, and the area of Museumsufer where the Museum of Regional Historic Art and Culture, the German Archietecture Museum, and the Jewish Museum can be found.

Winding through the center of Frankfurt is the beautiful Main River. One of the bigger tributaries of the Rhine, Main River is flanked by wide pathways and green spaces where visitors can enjoy a brisk walk and take in some of Frankfurt's best scenery.

Ip ,Hong Kong Discover the neighborhoods of Frankfurt am Main Central Station 106 hotels Offenbach 41 hotels Bockenheim / Rödelheim 33 hotels Gallus 32 hotels City Center 31 hotels Sachsenhausen 22 hotels Eschborn 21 hotels Frankfurt West 18 hotels Westend 17 hotels Ostend 16 hotels Flughafen 13 hotels Niederrad 11 hotels Bad Soden 11 hotels Nordend 9 hotels Frankfurt North-West 7 hotels Frankfurt North 6 hotels Bergen-Enkheim / Seckbach 6 hotels Frankfurt East 5 hotels Gutleutviertel 4 hotels Bad Vilbel 3 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Hostels in Frankfurt am Main 6 More about Frankfurt am Main Frankfurt is truly a city of contrasts. Monolithic skyscrapers sit beside traditional half-timbered houses and centuries-old cathedrals. And, though many remnants of Frankfurt's past remain, the city is one of the chief financial and business centers of Europe. As such, it's just as popular a destination for business as it is for tourism, and the high standard of services and technology offered at Frankfurt hotels reflects this. Frankfurt am Main International Airport is the gateway into the city, so hotels near Frankfurt Airport are always close to full capacity, as are hotels in Bahnhofsviertel, where Frankfurt train station is located. Frankfurt, like many European cities, is connected by a vast subway network that is both efficient and easy to navigate. Trains provide easy access to historical areas such as Romerberg with its gorgeous old buildings from the 14th and 15th centuries, and the area of Museumsufer where the Museum of Regional Historic Art and Culture, the German Archietecture Museum , and the Jewish Museum can be found. Winding through the center of Frankfurt is the beautiful Main River. One of the bigger tributaries of the Rhine, Main River is flanked by wide pathways and green spaces where visitors can enjoy a brisk walk and take in some of Frankfurt's best scenery.
